message.content:
Step 1: Determine the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) from the income statement.  
• COGS = 10,400,000.00  

Step 2: Identify the Inventory amounts from the balance sheet.  
• Beginning Inventory (2023-12-31) = 0.00  
• Ending Inventory (2024-02-05) = 8,400,000.00  

Step 3: Calculate the average inventory.  
• Average Inventory = (Beginning Inventory + Ending Inventory) / 2  
• = (0.00 + 8,400,000.00) / 2  
• = 4,200,000.00  

Step 4: Calculate the Inventory Turnover Ratio.  
• Inventory Turnover Ratio = COGS / Average Inventory  
• = 10,400,000.00 / 4,200,000.00  
• ≈ 2.48  

Thus, the Inventory Turnover Ratio is approximately 2.48.

{ "solution": { "Inventory Turnover Ratio": "2.48" } }
